use.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: if you use a particular tool, method, service, ability etc, you do something with that tool, by means of that method etc, for a particular purpose
use.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: I’ll show you which room you can use.
I always use the same shampoo.
Use your imagination when planning meals.
She booked the flight using a false name.
Drop-down menus make the program very easy to use.
They were using animals for scientific experiments.
Bob uses the van for picking up groceries.
My parents use the house as a holiday home.
Most people now use their cars to go shopping.
use.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to take an amount of something from a supply of food, gas, money etc
use.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: We use about £40 worth of electricity a month.
Standard washing machines use about 40 gallons of water.
use.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: to make someone do something for you in order to get something you want
use.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Can’t you see that Howard is just using you?
Gerald had been using her for his own ends.
use.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: to take advantage of a situation
use.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: She used her position as manager to get jobs for her friends.
use.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: to say or write a particular word or phrase
use.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: We use the word ‘hardware’ to describe the actual machine.
use.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: use
to use something for a particular purpose
Do you mind if I use your phone?
They rebuilt the church using local stone.
We use a range of different methods.
make use of something
to use something that is available to you
Staff can make use of a wide range of facilities.
She made full use of her contacts within the organization.
employ
to use a particular method or skill in order to achieve something
The surgeons employed a new technique.
They employed every means at their disposal (=every available method).
utilize
to use something that is available to you, for a practical purpose
The company has developed a new way to utilize solar energy.
a better way of utilizing the space
exploit
to use something as fully and effectively as possible, or to use something that will give you an advantage over your opponent
The country’s natural resources have not yet been fully exploited.
He was quick to exploit any weakness in his opponent’s argument.
apply
to use something such as a method, idea, or system in a particular situation
New technology is being applied to almost every industrial process.
I wanted to apply the things that I had learned on the course.
draw on something
to use information, knowledge, or experience that you have learned in the past
He was able to draw on his own experience as a diplomat when he was writing the book.
Journalists draw on information from many different sources.
resort to something
to use violence, force, threats etc as a way of achieving something
Extremists on both sides resort to violence.
We are prepared to resort to force if necessary.
to use your power or your rights
exercise
to use your rights, authority, influence etc
Only 40% of the population exercised their right to vote.
Congress must decide whether to exercise its veto.
wield
to use great power or influence
The central banks wield enormous power.
use.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: the action or fact of using something
use.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: an exit for use in emergencies
the increasing use of computers in education
use.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: a purpose for which something can be used
use.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: Robots have many different uses in modern industry.
The cupboard is full of things I can never find a use for.
use.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: one of the meanings of a word, or the way that a particular word is used
use.translation[1].note_box[0].sections[: The widespread use of computers changed business completely.
Doing the work in stages makes the most efficient use of resources.
We need to consider whether there could be a more effective use of our time.
The heavy use of pesticides in the area led to severe health problems.
These drugs are not recommended for regular use.
We want to encourage employees to make greater use of the sports facilities.
Our department is responsible for establishing the guidelines for land use in the county.
Drug use among teenage boys is on the increase.
